newsitem.title: PERU: Telefonica del Peru gets $100 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: Telefonica del Peru gets $100 mln loan.

text.p: Peruvian telecommunications company Telefonica del Peru said Wednesday it had agreed to a $100 million short-term loan from Santander Investment.

"Telefonica del Peru has closed a credit agreement with Santander Investment under which it obtains a short-term loan for $100,000 for a nine-month period with the possibility of extension," Telefonica said in a statement.
"This is one of the highest loans given to a company of prime importance in Peru," it added.
Telefnica said the interest rate applied to the loan would be LIBOR plus 0.5 percentage point annually.

"In the Peruvian financial world, the granting of this sort of credit is not a common practice," the statement said. "For this reason the accord should be understood as a show of confidence from Santander Investment in Telefnica del Per's solidity and the good direction of the Peruvian economy."
Telefnica did not specify what the loan would be used for.
